item.title: The Baron Thyssen Centre for the Study of Ancient Material Religion
Texts
item.description: Introduction Although the word ‘texts’ might imply a written document, the term has a wider scope in the field of religious studies. We can consider four categories of texts: Written documents. The most easily recognised form of text, for example the Bible or the Qur’an. Though often considered ‘fixed’ and unchanging, written texts are frequently altered and edited over long periods, and alternate versions of the same text are sometimes purged to create the image of uniformity.
